newsitem.title: FRANCE: Korea "not shocked but amazed" at Thomson reaction.
newsitem.headline: Korea "not shocked but amazed" at Thomson reaction.

text.p: South Korean Foreign Minister Gong Ro-Myung said on Friday he was was amazed at criticism in France of the planned takeover of consumer electronics group Thomson Multimedia by South Korea's Daewoo Electronics.
"I am not shocked but reasonably amazed about the reaction from some quarters in France," Gong said at a news conference.
"But this is essentially a domestic issue," he said.

Gong, who was in France for a ceremony marking South Korea's invitation to join the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, said Thomson Multimedia's parent Thomson SA was being privatised and he had nothing to add on the matter.

Four trade unions at a Thomson SA factory in Anger in the west of France called on its 1,370 workers to down tools for an hour on Friday at 1000 GMT, to protest against the planned sale of the Multimedia arm to Daewoo Electronics.
Thomson Multimedia employees have called on the company's 5,500 workers, employed in 11 sites throughout France, to demonstrate in Paris on November 20 against the sale.

The French government wants to sell Thomson to the Lagardere conglomerate for a symbolic one franc, allowing Lagardere to retain the CSF defence arm and dispose of Thomson Multimedia to Daewoo, also for one franc.
The socialist and communist groups in France's National Assembly have called for a committee of inquiry into the conditions of Thomson's privatisation.
